channel.title: Grade 11 English Poetry
channel.description:
i have to read this poem and have to answer this question: [b]Describe the overall message/meaning of the poem. -This is connected to the theme[/b] I have typed it exactly how its in my book
Title of poem: Where I Come From Poem By: Elizabeth Brewster
People are made of places. They carry with them hints of jungles or mountains, a tropic grace or the cool eyes of sea-gazers. Atmosphere of cities how dirfferent drops from them, like the smell of smog or the almost-not-smell of tulips in the spring, nature tidily plotted in little squares with a fountain in the centre; museum smell, art also tidily plotted with a guidebook; or the smell of work, glue factories maybe, chromium-platted offices; smell of subways crowded at rush hours.
Where i come fromm people carry wood in theie minds, acres of pine woods; blueberry patches in the burned-out bush; wooden farmhouses, old, in need of paint, with yards where hen and chickens circle about, clucking aimlessly; battered schoolhouses behind which violets grow. Spring and winter are the mind's cheif seasons: ice and the breaking of ice
A door in the mind blows open, and there blows a frosty wind from fields of snow.
thx in advance

item.title: Grade 11 English Poetry
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

i have to read this poem and have to answer this question:
Describe the overall message/meaning of the poem.
-This is connected to the theme
I have typed it exactly how its in my book

Title of poem: Where I Come From
Poem By: Elizabeth Brewster

People are made of places. They carry with them
hints of jungles or mountains, a tropic grace
or the cool eyes of sea-gazers. Atmosphere of cities
how dirfferent drops from them, like the smell of smog
or the almost-not-smell of tulips in the spring,
nature tidily plotted in little squares
with a fountain in the centre; museum smell,
art also tidily plotted with a guidebook;
or the smell of work, glue factories maybe,
chromium-platted offices; smell of subways
crowded at rush hours.

                            Where i come fromm people

carry wood in theie minds, acres of pine woods;
blueberry patches in the burned-out bush;
wooden farmhouses, old, in need of paint,
with yards where hen and chickens circle about,
clucking aimlessly; battered schoolhouses
behind which violets grow. Spring and winter
are the mind’s cheif seasons: ice and the breaking of ice

A door in the mind blows open, and there blows a frosty wind from fields of snow.

thx in advance
